p: In treated patients the emergence of resistant virus may be associated with persistence of viral recovery and in some studies delays in resolution of illness in immunocompetent persons. Although patients who had resistance emergence during the course of therapy had a somewhat longer time to resolution of symptoms, fever, and possibly functional impairment, they still had a more rapid recovery than placebo-treated patients [ 23, 27]. Patients may have worsening symptoms or viral titers when resistance emerges as well [ 23].
